title: Japan's 'naked' festival of the gods
p: For more than 1,000 years, people in Chiba have honoured Japan's eight-million gods by carrying them out to sea as part of a Hadaka Matsuri ("naked festival").

title: A mysterious ode to the Knights Templar
p: At the heart of Sintra's Quinta da Regaleira, a breath-taking initiation well celebrates Portugal's unique historical connection to the mysterious Knights Templar.

title: The US’ little-known subculture
p: “Hons” have become one of Baltimore’s most prominent mascots – but the subculture's roots can be traced to humble beginnings.

title: What makes this country so happy?
p: Despite being prone to natural disasters, this Pacific archipelago's unique combination of sustainability and tradition makes it one of the happiest places in the world.

title: The artefacts hidden from the Taliban
p: After thousands of priceless artefacts were smashed by Taliban forces, the country’s National Museum is piecing the fragments back together and hopes to unveil them this year.

title: Japan’s naked art of body positivity
p: In Japan’s strongly hierarchical culture, naked communal bathing allows people to broach controversial topics and speak openly and honestly about their feelings.

title: Could this city be the new Rome?
p: Tunis is bursting with the creative energy of a generation taking full advantage of its newfound freedom of expression and fervour for preserving its heritage in unexpected ways.

title: The mystery at the bottom of Lake Ohrid
p: On the shore of one of Europe’s oldest lakes, two families have been guarding a tightly held treasure for 100 years: fish pearls.
